question: Q560
question_text: Can CKM matrix be derived from k parameter mismatch?

fritzsch_relation.significance: Cabibbo angle determined by mass ratios to 0.3%!

k_parameter_insight.insight: k has TWO roles: fixing Q and fixing mass ratios
k_parameter_insight.note: These give different k values - important constraint!

geometric_interpretation.ckm_meaning: CKM from mass ratios, masses from Koide

derivation_chain: K parameters for quarks give Q deviation (Phase 123)

conclusion.key_result: V_us from Fritzsch relation to 0.3% accuracy
conclusion.connection: Mass ratios -> CKM, masses -> Koide, Koide -> coordination
conclusion.open_question: What determines k algebraically from coordination?
conclusion.significance: CKM mixing connects to coordination framework through mass hierarchy

Q585.question: Can k parameter be derived from coordination bounds?
Q585.description: k encodes QCD effects - is there an algebraic formula?

Q586.question: Can we derive V_cb and V_ub from modified Fritzsch?
Q586.description: Classic Fritzsch fails for V_cb - what modification works?
